char* mystrcat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src 
)

Appends the src string to the dest string, overwriting terminating null byte at the end of dest, and adds a terminating null byte.

Parameters:
dest String to be appended.
src String to append to.
Returns:
A concatenated string from src and dest.

char* mystrdup ( const char *  src  ) 

Duplicates a C-style string.

Parameters:
src Pointer to string to be copied
Returns:
Pointer to freshly-allocated string containing a duplicate of src or null if no memory is available

size_t mystrlen ( const char *  s  ) 

Finds the length of the null terminated string.

Parameters:

Returns:
The length of the string.

char* mystrncat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Appends the src string to the dest string, overwriting terminating null byte at the end of dest, and adds a terminating null byte- however, this function uses at most n bytes from src.

Parameters:
dest String to be appended.
src String to append to.
n Max number of bytes to append.
Returns:
A concatenated string from src and dest, at a limit of n.

char* mystrncpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Copies the string pointed to by src, including the terminating null byte to the buffer pointed to by dest, at most n bytes.

Parameters:
dest String to copy to
src String to be copied
n Max number of bytes to cpy
Returns:
A pointer to the destination string dest

char* mystrndup ( const char *  s,
size_t  n 
)

Deep copy the src string in a new block, leaves the original intact.

Parameters:
n Max number of bytes to duplicate
Returns:
Pointer to deep copied string containing a duplicate of src
